location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.606 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, relating to the kidnap and sale of a Somallee [Somali] girl by an inhabitant of Soor [Ṣūr]. Enclosed with the letter is an extract of paragraph 15 from despatch no.30 of 1855 (folio 178) from the Court of Directors, dated 19 December 1855, stating that in the event of the Somali girl’s return, the Imam of Muscat and his authorities will be held responsible for their promise of punishing the kidnapper.
